monster.name: Durak's Undying Minion
languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Swarming Attack
entries: The minion gains a +2 bonus to its attack roll if at least two other minions are within 5 feet of the target.

action.name: Call of the Undying
entries: The minion lets out a chilling howl, summoning reinforcements from the depths of the ethereal plane. As an action, the minion can use this ability. Until the start of its next turn, if the minion takes damage and drops to 0 hit points, it immediately explodes in a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature within 5 feet of the minion must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the minion dies before the start of its next turn after using this ability, {@dice 1d4} additional minions appear in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of its corpse. These new minions have the same statistics as the original minion and act immediately after it in the initiative order.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6+2}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The leopard has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the leopard moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a horns attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the leopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the undead yak to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the undead yak drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The undead yak makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its hooves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Terrifying Bellow {@recharge 5}
entries: he undead yak emits a haunting bellow. Each creature of the undead yak's choice within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Rapid Retreat
entries: As a bonus action, the scout can command its war horse to disengage from combat without provoking opportunity attacks.

bonus.name: Mounted Assault
entries: Once per turn, if the scout moves at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a target, it gains advantage on its next ranged attack roll against that target.

bonus.name: Swift Shot
entries: If the scout uses its bonus action to disengage, it can make a ranged attack against a different target within its longbow's range without disadvantage.

bonus.name: Coordinated Assault
entries: If both scouts target the same creature with ranged attacks on the same turn, they gain a +2 bonus to their attack rolls against that creature.

monster.name: Yal'Kor Skeleton Archer
languages: Understands the language it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton archer makes two longbow attacks

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Yal'Kor Skeleton Guard
languages: Understands the language it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton guard makes two longsword attacks

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horn Attack Charge
entries: Once per short rest, the skeleton guard can make a horn attack charge. It moves up to its speed in a straight line and can make a gore attack against a target at the end of the charge. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Durak the Undying

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the ghost has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Incorporeal Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

legendaryHeader: The ghost can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ghost regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Ghostly Visage
entries: The ghost becomes {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Teleportation
entries: The ghost magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Gust of Wind
entries: The ghost creates a strong gust of wind in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from the ghost.

legendary.name: Spectral Grasp
entries: The ghost reaches out with spectral tendrils, targeting a creature within 30 feet. The target must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet towards the ghost.

mythicHeader: Lair Actions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the ghost can take a lair action to create the following effects. The ghost can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

mythic.name: Spectral Howl
entries: The ghost emits a haunting howl, summoning a swirling mist in a 30-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature within the area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

mythic.name: Ethereal Step
entries: The ghost can immediately move up to their speed and pass through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Ghost Yak Stampede
languages: Understands Common and Yal'Kor but can't speak

trait.name: Ghostly Extension
entries: The ghost yaks are an extension of the Ghostly Nomad. As long as the Ghostly Nomad is alive, the ghost yaks cannot be killed. If reduced to 0 hit points, any further damage to the ghost yak is dealt to its owner.

action.name: Stampede
entries: The yak moves up to 60 feet in a straight line and passes through creatures. Each creature in its path must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half damage and not being knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

monster.name: Spectral Yak
languages: Understands the languages of its summoner but can't speak.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charge
entries: If the spectral yak moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Giant Transport
entries: The Yakstronaut has a large open cockpit on its back, capable of carrying up to 6 Medium creatures. The riders in the cockpit have half cover against ranged attacks and gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws against area effects targeting the Yakstronaut. Additionally, while in the cockpit, riders can use their action to make ranged weapon attacks with bows, crossbows, or similar weapons.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The Yakstronaut has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

action.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the Yakstronaut moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Yakstronaut can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Flyby Attack
entries: The Yakstronaut moves without provoking opportunity attacks.

Born from a whimsical fusion of nature and invention, the Yakstronaut defies conventional expectations with its awe-inspiring presence. Towering over its surroundings, this living giant yak stands as a testament to the boundless imagination of its creator.

Its massive frame is adorned with a sturdy cockpit, a testament to the resourcefulness of those who seek to explore new frontiers. Within the protective embrace of the cockpit, adventurers find refuge, their movements guided by the gentle swaying of the Yakstronaut's powerful gait.

Atop its broad back rests a fantastical hot air balloon, a marvel of engineering and ingenuity. Fueled by the wind's whispers and the spirit of adventure, the balloon carries the Yakstronaut and its passengers high above the mundane world. From this vantage point, the party surveys the battlefield, strategizing and planning their maneuvers.

Beneath the Yakstronaut's rugged exterior lies a gentle spirit, its eyes gleaming with wisdom and its heart brimming with loyalty. This extraordinary creature exudes an air of tranquility, its rhythmic steps and gentle huffs resonating with a sense of reassurance.

As the Yakstronaut navigates the skies and land, its companions bear witness to a bond forged between nature and invention. Together, they soar through clouds and glide over valleys, a harmonious fusion of ancient strength and modern invention.

Within the cockpit, laughter mingles with the hum of gears, and the twang of bowstrings accompanies the rhythmic flapping of the hot air balloon. In the presence of the Yakstronaut, the possibilities seem endless, and the boundaries of the world grow ever smaller.

Embrace the Yakstronaut's embrace, adventurers, and let your spirits take flight upon its noble frame. Discover new horizons, forge unbreakable bonds, and revel in the wondrous tales that will forever be woven in the tapestry of your shared destiny.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Yal'Kor Refugee makes two attacks: one with its shortsword and one with its horn thrust.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) damage.

action.name: Horn Thrust
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) damage. If the target is surprised, the attack deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Commanding Presence
entries: The Yal'Kor Refugee has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks against creatures that have witnessed its Yak Transformation ability.

action.name: Yak Transformation
entries: As a bonus action, the Yal'Kor Refugee can become indistinguishable from a group of yaks until the start of its next turn. While transformed, it gains advantage on Stealth checks.

action.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, when the Yal'Kor Refugee hits a target with a melee attack and has advantage on the attack roll, it can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage.

action.name: Tactical Retreat
entries: As a reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of the Yal'Kor Refugee, it can move up to half its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Yal'Kor Refugees, cunning survivors of a war-torn land, blend into the landscape by disguising themselves as yaks. Their transformation ability allows them to disappear into a herd, granting them an advantage in stealth. They utilize their strategic positioning and command of the battlefield to gain the upper hand in combat. With their horns and quick reflexes, they strike swiftly and precisely, taking advantage of surprise attacks whenever possible. Their presence on the battlefield can be intimidating, and they are skilled at exploiting moments of opportunity to tactically retreat or reposition themselves.

trait.name: Group Token
entries: The Yal'Kor Refugee function as a group token, representing 5 Yal'Kor Refugee. This allows them to act simultaneously and simplifies the turn order and battle map.

trait.name: Group Token
entries: The Yal'Kor Townsfolk function as a group token, representing 5 townsfolk. This allows them to act simultaneously and simplifies the turn order and battle map.

trait.name: Horned Charge
entries: When the Yal'Kor Townsfolk move at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Resilient Nomads
entries: The Yal'Kor Townsfolk have advantage on saving throws against {@condition exhaustion} and resistance to cold damage.

trait.name: Tribal Assault
entries: When at least one ally is within 10 feet of a Yal'Kor Townsfolk group token, it gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls.

trait.name: Tribal Resilience
entries: When at least two allies are within 20 feet of a Yal'Kor Townsfolk group token, they have advantage on saving throws against all conditions and resistance to all damage types.

trait.name: Tribal Coordination
entries: When at least three allies are within 30 feet of a Yal'Kor Townsfolk group token, they can use their Horned Charge ability even if they have moved less than 20 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Yal'Kor Townsfolk make two melee attacks.

action.name: Melee Attack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Rallying Cry
entries: When an ally within 10 feet of a Yal'Kor Townsfolk is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, the Yal'Kor Townsfolk gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt to the fallen ally. These temporary hit points last until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Group Token
entries: The Yal'Kor Scout Trio functions as a group token, representing 3 Yal'Kor Scouts. This allows them to act simultaneously and simplifies the turn order and battle map.

trait.name: Nomadic Riders
entries: The Yal'Kor Scout Trio gains a +2 bonus to AC while mounted.

trait.name: Nimble Maneuvers
entries: The Yal'Kor Scout Trio can use their bonus actions to Dash, Disengage, or Hide.

trait.name: Agile Evasion
entries: When the Yal'Kor Scout Trio is targeted by a ranged attack, they can use their reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Triple Attack
entries: The Yal'Kor Scout Trio makes three melee attacks, one for each member.

action.name: Polearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Daring Flourish
entries: When the Yal'Kor Scout Trio hits with all three polearm attacks against a target, they can use their reaction to make three additional dagger attacks against that target.

reaction.name: Skirmisher's Escape
entries: When an enemy creature ends its turn within 5 feet of the Yal'Kor Scout Trio, they can use their reaction to move up to their movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Swift Retreat
entries: When the Yal'Kor Scout Trio takes the Disengage action, their movement speed is doubled until the end of their turn.

trait.name: Spiritual Guidance
entries: The Yal'Kor Shaman has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Healing Aura
entries: At the start of its turn, the Yal'Kor Shaman can choose up to three creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each chosen creature regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + the shaman's Wisdom modifier (3)

trait.name: Nomadic Mobility
entries: The Yal'Kor Shaman's movement speed is not reduced by difficult terrain, and it can Dash as a bonus action.

action.name: Staff Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Yal'Kor Shaman is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The shaman has the following cleric spells prepared:

entries: The Yal'Kor Shaman moves with an ethereal grace, a conduit between the physical realm and the spiritual realm. Adorned in flowing robes and adorned with mystical symbols, the shaman carries a staff adorned with feathers, beads, and sacred objects. Their eyes gleam with ancient wisdom, reflecting the deep connection they have forged with the natural world.

Born from the nomadic traditions of the Yal'Kor people, the shaman walks a path of healing and guidance. They draw upon the raw energy of the land, harnessing the power of the elements to mend wounds and offer solace to their comrades. With each step, they carry the weight of the tribe's hopes and dreams, serving as a beacon of hope and a conduit for spiritual energy.

Their healing aura emanates a soothing light, suffusing the battlefield with revitalizing energies. Allies find renewed strength in their presence, their injuries closing swiftly under the shaman's gentle touch. With each whispered chant and flicker of their staff, the shaman calls upon the spirits, weaving the threads of the ethereal realm into a tapestry of restoration.

While their focus lies primarily on healing, the shaman is not defenseless. When threatened, they can wield their staff with surprising agility or unleash bolts of spiritual energy to ward off attackers. Yet, it is their unwavering dedication to aiding others that defines them, for their true power lies in the art of mending and rejuvenation.

The Yal'Kor Shaman, a bridge between the physical and spiritual, offers not only healing to their tribe but also guidance in times of uncertainty. Their presence brings comfort and reassurance, and their words carry the weight of ancient wisdom. In the heart of battle or during quiet moments of reflection, the shaman's connection to the sacred powers of the world shines through, reminding all that they are not alone in their journey through life.

trait.name: Group Token
entries: The Tourist Hunter Group functions as a group token, representing 4 hunters. This allows them to act simultaneously and simplifies the turn order and battle map.

trait.name: Riches and Resources
entries: The Tourist Hunter Group is well-equipped and carries the finest hunting gear available. They have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Pay to Play
entries: The Tourist Hunter Group may attempt to resolve conflicts through financial means, offering bribes or negotiating deals. They have advantage on Persuasion checks when attempting to resolve situations through monetary means.

trait.name: Fashionable Hunters
entries: The Tourist Hunter Group wears stylish attire, favoring Aloha Armor shirts and shorts over traditional hunting gear.

trait.name: Hunting Bow with High-Power Optic
entries: The Tourist Hunter Group wields Hunting Bows equipped with high-power optics, allowing them to shoot at maximum range without suffering disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Arrow Specializations
entries: The Tourist Hunter Group carries different types of arrows to suit various combat situations. They have access to four types of specialized arrows: Blast, Lethal, Precision, and Chaos.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tourist Hunter Group makes four attacks, one for each member, only the first attack of the multiattack can be a specialization arrow.

action.name: Hunting Bow with High-Power Optic
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. This bow is a +1 magical weapon and allows shooting at maximum range without suffering disadvantage.

action.name: Blast Arrows
entries: These arrows explode upon impact, dealing damage to targets within a small area. On a hit, the primary target takes full damage, while creatures within a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking half damage on a failed save.

action.name: Lethal Arrows
entries: These arrows are designed to cause maximum harm, adding an extra {@damage 1d6} piercing damage on a successful hit.

action.name: Precision Arrows
entries: These arrows are meticulously crafted for accuracy, granting a +2 bonus to the attack roll.

action.name: Chaos Arrows
entries: These arrows are enchanted with unpredictable magic, creating a variety of unexpected effects upon impact. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects:

Confusion: The target becomes disoriented and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.
Stun: The target is {@condition stunned} and unable to take actions or reactions for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.
Slow: The target's speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

Fear: The target becomes {@condition frightened} and must use its movement to move away from the source of fear. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

Blindness: The target becomes {@condition blinded} and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks that rely on vision for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.
Silence: The target is unable to speak, and any verbal spells it attempts to cast fail for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect.

The Tourist Hunter Group is a band of wealthy thrill-seekers who have embarked on a grand adventure. These well-heeled hunters are known for their extravagant lifestyles and their penchant for pursuing rare trophies across the realm. Clad in fashionable attire that defies traditional hunting garb, they don fantasy Hawaiian shirts and shorts, making a bold statement of their opulence and distinct style.

Equipped with the finest hunting gear money can buy, the Tourist Hunter Group spares no expense in acquiring the most exquisite and meticulously crafted weapons. Their Hunting Bows, enhanced with high-power optics, allow them to strike with unerring precision even at extreme distances, providing a competitive edge in their pursuit of elusive prey. Each arrow they loose from their bows has been carefully chosen for its specific purpose, ensuring they are always ready for any challenge that may arise.

Within their arsenal, they carry specialized arrows that cater to different combat scenarios. The Blast Arrows, when unleashed, create explosive bursts upon impact, wreaking havoc on their targets and those unfortunate enough to be in the vicinity. The Lethal Arrows are designed for maximum damage, allowing the Tourist Hunter Group to strike with deadly force. Precision Arrows, meticulously crafted with exceptional accuracy in mind, grant the hunters an edge in hitting their mark. The Chaos Arrows, enchanted with unpredictable magic, introduce an element of unpredictability, inflicting various captivating effects on their targets, ranging from confusion to stunning or even instilling fear.

Not only do their exceptional abilities make them formidable foes, but their wealth and resources also grant them an advantage when it comes to negotiations and conflict resolution. The Tourist Hunter Group is no stranger to using their financial power to sway situations in their favor, often attempting to buy their way out of trouble or negotiate deals with their adversaries.

Accompanying their extravagant lifestyle is the magical Aloha Armor they don. When activated, this enchanting Hawaiian shirt transforms the surroundings into a tropical paradise, complete with swaying palm trees, gentle ocean breezes, and the soothing sounds of waves crashing upon the shore. Within this sanctuary, they find respite from charm and fear effects, allowing them to maintain their composure and navigate dangerous situations with grace.

With their combined skills, opulent resources, and a burning desire for adventure, the Tourist Hunter Group is always ready to face any challenge head-on. Whether it's tracking mythical creatures or securing legendary trophies, they are a force to be reckoned with, leaving their mark on the realm with style, sophistication, and a touch of chaos.

trait.name: Siege Weapon
entries: The Yal'Kor Siege Ballista is a formidable stationary siege engine. It cannot move and attack in the same turn.

trait.name: Reinforced Construction
entries: The Siege Ballista has sturdy and durable construction, granting it resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Operator Dependent
entries: The Siege Ballista requires an operator to function effectively. The operator is a separate entity with its own hit points. If the operator is killed, the Siege Ballista becomes inoperable until a new operator takes control.

action.name: Ballista Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10+4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Siege Ballista Operator
entries: The Yal'Kor Siege Ballista Operator is skilled in operating the siege ballista, enabling the siege engine to unleash devastating attacks.

action.name: Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Repair
entries: The operator uses their action to repair the Siege Ballista. The Siege Ballista regains 10 hit points.

action.name: Assist
entries: The operator can use their action to assist the Siege Ballista Operator. The Siege Ballista Operator gains advantage on their next attack roll made with the Siege Ballista.

trait.name: Group Token
entries: The Yal'Kor Scout Horse Rider Group functions as a group token, representing 3 riders. This allows them to act simultaneously and simplifies the turn order and battle map.

trait.name: Swift Movement
entries: The Scout Horse Riders have a speed of 60 feet, enabling them to traverse the battlefield swiftly and maintain distance from melee attacks.

trait.name: Mounted Assault
entries: Once per turn, if a scout moves at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a target, it gains advantage on its next ranged attack roll against that target.

trait.name: Coordinated Assault
entries: If one scout hits a creature with a ranged attack, the next scout to attack the same creature gains a +2 bonus to their attack roll against that creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Yal'Kor Scout Horse Rider Group makes three attacks: one with their Longbow each.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Agile Maneuver
entries: The Scout Horse Riders can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage action

reaction.name: Evasive Shot
entries: When a Scout Horse Rider is targeted by a ranged attack, it can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

The Yal'Kor Scout Horse Rider Group emerges from the mist, their dark grey yak fur attire blending seamlessly with the shadows. Mounted atop their agile horses, they appear as swift specters, ready to unleash a hailstorm of arrows upon their unsuspecting targets. With bows held firmly in hand, their steeds carry them with grace and precision across the battlefield.

Their attire, made from the resilient and warm yak fur, provides them with protection from the elements while also aiding in their stealthy movements. The group's expertise lies in their ability to swiftly navigate the treacherous terrains of the land, combining the agility of their mounts with their keen archery skills.

As they ride, their bows become extensions of their beings, effortlessly drawing and releasing arrows with practiced precision. Each rider takes aim with unwavering focus, taking advantage of their dark grey attire to blend into the shadows and strike from unexpected angles.

With calculated coordination, the Yal'Kor Scout Horse Rider Group orchestrates their attacks, relying on their swift movements and collective prowess to confound and overwhelm their adversaries. Their skillful horsemanship, coupled with their mastery of the bow, allows them to deliver devastating volleys of arrows while always maintaining a safe distance from their foes.

Their allegiance to the yaks, creatures native to their homelands, is evident in their choice of fur attire. It serves as a reminder of the resilience and adaptability they possess as nomadic hunters on the rugged plains. They are a formidable force, embodying the spirit of their people and the untamed nature of their homeland.

In the heat of battle, the Yal'Kor Scout Horse Rider Group becomes an elusive and deadly force, striking swiftly and vanishing into the horizon as if they were never there. Their dark grey yak fur garments, horses, and bows have become symbols of their unity and proficiency, signifying their unwavering commitment to their nomadic way of life.

Beware the shadowed figures on horseback, for they are the Yal'Kor Scout Horse Rider Group, swift hunters of the steppe, whose arrows find their mark with unerring precision, leaving their enemies in awe and their allies inspired by their relentless pursuit of victory.

trait.name: Commanding Presence
entries: The commander has advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with Yal'Kor units.

trait.name: Disciplined Unit
entries: Yal'Kor horseback archers within 60 feet of the commander act simultaneously on the commander's turn.

bonus.name: Change Stance
entries: The commander can issue orders to his men, commanding them to change their stance. The Yal'Kor horseback archers within 60 feet can choose one of the following stances as a bonus action:

bonus.name: Attack Stance
entries: While in this stance, the Yal'Kor horseback archers gain a +2 bonus to their attack rolls.

bonus.name: Defense Stance
entries: While in this stance, the Yal'Kor horseback archers gain a +2 bonus to their Armor Class.

bonus.name: Speed Stance
entries: While in this stance, the Yal'Kor horseback archers' movement speed increases by 10 feet.

reaction.name: Evasive Maneuver
entries: When the commander is targeted by a melee attack, it can use its reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The commander makes two attacks: one with its longbow and one with its shortsword.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Alchemical Arsenal
entries: The archer alchemist can use a bonus action to draw or stow an alchemical vial. When using a potion or vial, the archer alchemist can do so as part of an attack or the Use an Object action.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. With the affect from one potion vial.

action.name: Explosive Shot
entries: The archer alchemist can make a ranged attack using a vial filled with explosive potion instead of a regular attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} fire damage and creatures within 5 feet of the target must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking half damage on a success.

action.name: Healing Shot
entries: The archer alchemist can make a ranged attack using a vial filled with healing potion instead of a regular attack. On a hit, the target regains {@dice 3d6 + 4} hit points.

action.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: The archer alchemist can throw a smoke bomb as a bonus action. The smoke bomb creates a 20-foot radius sphere of dense smoke centered on a point within 30 feet of the alchemist. The area is heavily obscured and blocks line of sight until the end of the alchemist's next turn.

action.name: Acidic Flask
entries: The archer alchemist can throw an acidic flask as a ranged attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage and must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or have its AC reduced by 2 for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Teleportation Arrow
entries: The archer alchemist fires a specialized arrow imbued with teleportation magic. When the arrow impacts an object, the alchemist teleports to the location of impact as a bonus action. The alchemist can use the teleportation arrow as part of an attack or the Use an Object action.
